name: Conveyo
description:
Biweekly Games 3 - Conveyo

A game about assembling pieces of blocks together to pass a series of obstacles coming in from a conveyor belt.

You can place pieces from the available piece pool by clicking on a piece and clicking again on where you want to move it. Pieces can be rotated, and can oly be placed on top of another piece or when grounded (think Tetris). You can undo placements by pressing R or clicking on the undo button.

After assembling the object you want with whatever pieces you have, you can start the level by clicking the green button, and see if your object can pass through the obstacles. Whenever an obstacle collides with a piece, its blocks collide with your object's blocks:

  • If the blocks are the same color, they're both destroyed.
  • If they're different colors, only the object block is destroyed.

You win a level by making an object that survives the obstacles with at least one piece.

Controls:

  • Left Mouse Click: Dragging pieces, Start Level Button, Fast Forward Button, Undo button.
  • A/D: Rotate currently dragged piece clockwise/counter-clockwise.
  • R: Undo last placement.

More info:

This game was made on a personal challenge to develop and release one game every 2 weeks on my spare time around school and work (which is not exactly punctual...). I generate a random theme prompt to poll ideas from, and the theme for this game was "Assemble". You can read more about this game here.
